title: How to Store Herb and Flower Oils

steps.headline: Use the right storage containers.
steps.description: When making your own scented oils, always remember that light destroys scent. As such, the very best containers are usually dark ones, such as amber colored or dark glass. Also, ensure that the storage bottles are airtight, as air destroys the scent quickly when it gets inside the bottle.

steps.headline: Store bottles and jars of fragrant or herbal oils away from sources of heat and light.
steps.description: Always prefer a cool, dark and dry location to keep them, such as a back shelf of the pantry.

steps.headline: Remember that all oils soon oxidize.
steps.description: Use oils within the time specified by the recipe. Avoid keeping mixed oils any longer than two months. This is especially important where the oil mix includes a carrier oil base, as when mixing essential oils with a carrier oil. These mixtures tend to begin oxidizing as soon as they are blended.

steps.headline: For commercially produced herb and flower oils, follow the instructions.
steps.description: Many will advise either cool storage or even refrigeration.

text: Use the right storage containers. When making your own scented oils, always remember that light destroys scent. As such, the very best containers are usually dark ones, such as amber colored or dark glass. Also, ensure that the storage bottles are airtight, as air destroys the scent quickly when it gets inside the bottle. Store bottles and jars of fragrant or herbal oils away from sources of heat and light. Always prefer a cool, dark and dry location to keep them, such as a back shelf of the pantry. Remember that all oils soon oxidize. Use oils within the time specified by the recipe. Avoid keeping mixed oils any longer than two months. This is especially important where the oil mix includes a carrier oil base, as when mixing essential oils with a carrier oil. These mixtures tend to begin oxidizing as soon as they are blended. For commercially produced herb and flower oils, follow the instructions. Many will advise either cool storage or even refrigeration.
